container-title: Selected Poems of Solomon Ibn Gabirol
title: bring to life the first of the four great figures in the revival of Hebrew poetry in Spain, dubbed the Golden Age in Hebrew letters; Coles followed this prize-winning volume with an even more illuminating volume on the second of those exemplary Jewish intellectuals and poets

note: the text at the center of the controversies over Dante's knowledge of the Islamic apocrypha recounting the Prophet's ascent to Heaven and descent to Hell: // Libra delta
title: Although no worthy English translation exists yet of the Tawq al-Hamama by Ibn Hazm of Cordoba, one can now add to the old and useful Spanish translation by Emilio Garcia Gomez a brilliant rendering into modern French by Gabriel Martinez-Gros, De I'amour et des amants
It is also worth noting that there are now, finally, modern Italian and Spanish translations of the Liber Scalae Mahometi

note: and Raymond Scheindlin's Afterword 160 two volumes of selections from the Hebrew poetry of Spain, Wine, Women, & Death and The Gazelle (both now New York: Oxford University Press, 1999).
title: Scala di Maometto
with an excellent introduction by Carlo Saccone, and Libra de la Escala de Mahoma

It is, finally, very much worth noting that there are currently available a number of anthologies of particular value for teaching: Olivia Remie Constable's general Medieval Iberia: Readings from Christian, Muslim, and Jewish Sources
Robert Irwin's Night and Horses and the Desert
which offers a broad overview of Arabic literature, with Hispano-Arabic selections thus readable in that canonical context
